text: The washed out sky hangs over the open fields in the midd of nowhere. It has rained recently and the ground is wet around the scattered mail boxes that line the old gravel road. The street is deserted. Empty.

A large single story house sits a thousand yards from its closest neighbor. There is a long cement driveway that le down the side of the property. At the end, towards the house, sits a once blue four-door sedan. Smoke rises above the charred remains. The windows are smashed out and the tires are slashed. Broken pieces glass surround the car as it sits flat against its metal rims. The car is running. Over the blackened hood stands a faded basketball goal. A net hangs on for its life from the rusty orange hoop.
1801 Clark Road. Stop. (Coughs) 1801 Clark Road as follows: 4 kitchen knives, varying sizes. 2 candle sticks. One large axe with wooden handle.

TwO YOUNG BOYS, both in their early teens, walk side by s with their bicycles. They wear pressed white shirts and black slacks. They are Mormons. The taller boy, has a backpack slung over one shoulder. T other one holds a pile of pamphlets. They both have flat tops.  2. The boys make their way down the street and they huddle c together to attempt to shield themselves from the wind whipping across their skin. They are two houses down from the basketball goal. So far no one is home on the street. They take turns walking to each house, knocking and ringing the doorbells. When ther is no answer, they leave the pamphlets on the mat or in t mailbox and walk back up to the road again. The boys do not play around with each other as they walk road between houses. They concentrate on the task at hand each solemnly staring forward as they pass the overgrown yards.
Matches. One double barrel shot gun. 5 empty shells. Baling wire. A broken champagne bottle. Two empty bottles of beer.

Music drifts out to where the boys stand on the street fr somewhere within the large house. The boy with the backpack waits at the mailbox as the sma one walks down the driveway towards the blue-black family car. The smaller boy waves and calls out for his friend to com closer. The music grows louder so as to drown out all oth sound. Eventually, the boy with the backpack lays both the bikes down on the side of the street and walks towards the fron porch, cutting across the grass. The smaller boy stands near the car, staring at his reflection in the broken driver’s side window. He calls o to the boy with the backpack again, then chases after him towards the house.

The boy with the backpack picks up a champagne cork as th walk along the sidewalk to the porch. The smaller boy lau nervously as they get closer.  3. The boy with the backpack nudges h friend towards the door, but neither one walks inside.
Hello? Their bikes remain on the street.
A lot of blood. In several rooms. We have some usable prints. We need to get some people out into the yard. We have to go out into the field.

Dark shadows still surround most of the living room ahead them as the boys make their way down the front hall. The smashed pieces of a fire alarm lie on the ground near the entry way. Inaudible beneath the sound of the music, the boys call o as they walk through the darkened room, the pamphlets han the younger boys’ side.
(Coughs) No conformation yet on names. We’re working on it. We’ll be here all night. This is bad.
The boys walk through the living room as the music grows louder. No one responds to their calls.
A record spins on an old worn out player. The needle is close to the end as the volume steadily rises.

That’s all we got right now. Let’s go. Turn this thing off. The record slows and then stops leaving only the sound o static as the needle rides the edges before stopping. The house is completely quiet. One of the boys screams. FADE TO BLACK.

The doorway is dark as JAMES and KRISTEN walk in silently The bags and the cramped hallway make for a less than graceful transition inside the house. They are tired and angry. James walks ahead carrying the luggage. Kristen stands at the doorway finishing a cigarette in the warm light of th porch. She wipes tears from her face. They are still dressed from this evening’s wedding, but b look as if they have seen a battlefield. The stains of re wine cover Kristen’s skin. James’s white shirt is now mor pink than anything else. One of his hands is scraped away the knuckles. There is a small bit of blood.

It is dark inside as James walks around the huge living r He bumps into random pieces of furniture while he navigat his way around the crowded space in the shadows. He tosses the bags down in disgust as he searches for a l
Kristen flicks her cigarette into the grass and closes th door, blocking out the little light that was shining into house, leaving them in total darkness. James slams into the corner of a table.
Thank you. Kristen’s high heels make their way over the tiled entry and onto the hardwood floors of the living room.

I’m sorry. The sarcasm hangs in the air from both their voices as Ja finally gets a lamp on. Kristen watches James’ movements as he walks around flipp on switches with disgust. Her face reacts to what she see being illuminated in front of her. Each pool of light reveals more of the surprise James had planned for her th night. There are two place settings surrounded by candles on the dining room table. A bottle of champagne chills in an ice bucket. Many bright flower petals are scattered across th couch. With each flick of a switch, James attempts to remain emotionless, but his hands tremble as he works. Kristen reaches for support, accidentally leaning back against the piano keys. An abrupt burst of sound from the piano causes her to jump. Without trying to restrain herself, tears flow down her wine stained face.

James turns on the light in the parlor and the record pla starts up. There is a second of static and then the chord of an old country song slowly come up to speed. This hurt Kristen even more. James is caught off guard by these breaks from the silenc and he moves to shut down the record player, but he pause for a second and they both listen to the familiar song.
When did you do all this?
Today. When you were with the girls. Mike came down with me this morning. You were gone a long time. His back is turned to her. He watches the record swivel around in circles.
Kristen bends down and begins digging through one of her bags. She cannot find what she is looking for. Her movements are rushed, her hands violent.
What is it? What do you need?
I wanna take a bath. Where are my things?
I brought everything, all your stuff. It’s in the back. She looks up at him and this time he looks back at her.
I’m sorry. I just thought you forgot them.
No.
James turns back to the record player for a moment.
Then, he walks over to the dining room and takes out a sm ring box from his coat pocket, placing it on the table.
Come on.
He walks past her without a look in her direction and she follows him towards the light pouring from underneath the door at the end of the hall.

You can have this room. I’11 get set up out there. I don’t know about the tub. I put roses in there too. We didn’t know if they can go in first. Kristen almost wants to laugh, but she doesn’t.
I don’t know, either. He goes to leave, but turns back.

Come here. Let me get this.  8. He reaches over and touches her back, unzipping her dress her. She pulls it off with the ease of someone who has undressed in front of a person hundreds of times before.

He moves back over to the dining room table, where he sit down in the place James occupied an hour ago. He holds th old man’s hat in his hand. He pulls off his mask and sets it down next to the case f her ring. Sweat drips off his face. He is about the same age as James. He is tired, exhausted by the physical exertion of the night’s events. He lights a cigarette from her pack and leans back in the chair. The smoke rises above him in the moonlight. After a few seconds, he slides over the soggy carton of i cream from the table and opens the top. Cherry flavored cream drips into his beard as he eats the half melted dessert. He closes the lid, setting the spoon on top of the box an places it back in the center of the table. His eyes conti to rest on the ice cream as he softly sings.

As long as I got my Plastic Jesus... He sings to himself the same song Kristen sang minutes ag He slowly puts the mask back on and then turns ona flashlight, scanning the beam around the room. The light dances over the furniture as he searches. After a couple of quick drags, he stubs out his cigarette stands up. Then he walks out the door  89.

The door handle to the pantry twists as Kristen attempts open it. She is breathing hard as she builds the courage to open t door. It is an inch from her face and the sound of her breath against it is almost deafening. She is too frightened to push herself out. Her feet press against an old bag of cat food at the bottom of the pantr She can hear the click of the door as it crosses the wood notch and it begins to open, but suddenly stops. She push again, but the door does not move. The sound of her breat pounds in her ears as Kristen struggles more and more. Then she stops, holding her quivering hand in front of he mouth. Her eyes are wide as she stares out the door. She holds her breath, but the breathing sound continues. Two plastic eyes appear in the small slits directly in fr of Kristen face. Strawberry Shortcake’s plastic mask glar back at her.

I see you! The door slams against Kristen’s head, pushing her back i the cans and paper bags on the shelves behind her. Kriste screams as the door shakes back and forth. She kicks at i crying with pain as she fights the wood in front of her Then, a gunshot fires from outside the house and the door stops. It drifts open and a can of corn rolls out onto th linoleum floor of the kitchen. Kristen squeezes out onto the kitchen, limping. Her toes bloody from kicking. Her ankle is horribly swollen. She pulls open drawers and they fall to the ground spilli their contents onto the floor. She finds a knife, a much smaller one, and points it out in front of her. STRAWBERRY (cont’d) Hello. Kristen screams, turning to face Strawberry, who stands n the table. She holds the ring case in her hands.  90. STRAWBERRY (cont’d) Did you say yes?

What do you want? Strawberry is still, calm. Kristen’s knife does not seem frighten her. KRISTEN (cont’d) Where’s James? Strawberry shrugs her shoulders. Her plastic face smiling Kristen’s fear. She puts down the case next to the ice cream.
You’re so scared. Did you know the man you killed?
You did that. Leave us alone. Strawberry shakes her head “No” very slowly.
You’re gonna die.

One of the drawers Kristen had left hanging in its slot falls loose and clatters to the ground. Kristen shields herself from scattering contents and scoots sideways, but keeps her knife shakily pointing towards Strawberry.
Why did you come here? Why us!

Because you were home. You answered the door. Kristen shakes her head back and forth, the horrible realization sinking in. STRAWBERRY (cont’d) I don’t even know you. She moves towards Kristen but Kristen does not retreat an further.  91. Outside, there is a gunshot. Kristen turns towards the windows. The wind chimes blow in the breeze.
He’s going to kill you. Strawberry shakes her head again.
What’s your name?
I don’t want to tell you.
I heard him say it. But I don’t remember. Did you say yes?
He’s going to kill you.

No... he’s not. For a few moments neither woman speaks nor moves. Kristen sobs to herself, then the knife slowly lowers to the grou beside her. Strawberry continues to inch forward until she is only in away. Kristen seems oblivious to her. Underneath the plastic mask, she can hear the stranger’s breathing growi faster. In an instant it happens, one swipe of the blade and Strawberry falls back. Kristen holds the knife out and it covered in blood from the young girl. Strawberry is in pain. She holds her forearm, but her mas remains emotionless. Kristen watches her, waiting for a reaction. Then she hears the stranger laugh.

The back door opens through the curtains and James stumbl inside. He is badly beaten, his face already swollen arou the eyes and mouth. Kristen yanks herself up but quickly sees that he is not alone.  92. The Man in the Mask and the Pin Up Girl walk in behind hi The man holds the gun, shoving it into James’ back
You were wrong. James locks Kristen’s gaze with half closed eyes. His wil to fight has been beaten from him.
Put on a record. Kristen hobbles past them from the dining room into the hallway, then to the back bedrooms.

Kristen slams the door behind her as she falls against si of the bed in the dark room, sobbing. The power returns t the house and the bathroom light turns on. Near the bed, overturned clock radio beeps 12’oclock on the floor. Kristen stands up staring at the closed door. From the living room, the sound of the record player starts up, th volume cranked high so that song bleeds into the Kristen’ ears. Her feet crunch the broken glass beneath her but sh seems unfazed.

Kristen...Kristen...Kristen. Strawberry’s voice floats in from the other side of the d Her fingers tap the wood methodically. STRAWBERRY (0.S.) (cont’d) He told me. You said no. From the living room Kristen can hear the furniture movin loud crash, broken glass. STRAWBERRY (0.S.) (cont’d) You’re gonna die! Kristen stands, shaking and crying and facing the door. S wets herself and it pours down her legs, but she does not care.
Go away!
Kristen!  93.
Leave me alone. Her voice is like a child. She is begging, pleading. The door opens in front of her, but no one is there. In t hallway she can hear James screaming over the record.

Kristen! Kristen yells out towards him. She forms no words, just a cry, but she lets it out at the top of her lungs. She is frozen by his calls. JAMES (0.S.) (cont'd) Kristen! Finally, she moves towards the blaring music. She whisper to herself to build up confidence, her mouth moving over over but it makes no sound. Tears stream down her cheeks.

It’s okay, it’s okay, it’s okay. As she approaches the door frame, she stops and looks at large mirror hanging on the wall over the dresser. The mu continues to pound and James’ screams almost become part the melody. Suddenly the screams fall silent. Kristen turns and sprints for the door, but the Man in th Mask is waiting. He tosses her like a rag doll against th wall and she collapses. He grabs her by her hair and pulls her down the hallway, the old man, to the dinning room. She does not fight. She has the old man’s blood in her hair.

The Man in the Mask pauses half way through the room, struggling with her weight and his exhaustion. She stares at the blank eyes of the mask as he breathes. His hands tighten around the shoulders of her dress and she slides behind him.  94.

The table has been overturned and James is seated in the middle of room, tied to a chair. Beside him is an empty seat, and the man and the Pin Up Girl lift her into it. The music is incredibly loud now, making it impossible to hear anything else. Strawberry ties Kristen’s body to the chair using rusted baling wire. Then, she wires her hands together tightly i front of her while the Man in the Mask whispers in James’ ear. Kristen twists her wrists, but finds that only causes the wire to dig in deeper, cutting into her skin. James is crying. His pale face contorts with the understanding of the words coming from the plastic mouth. whispers back, begging and shaking his head. Neither he nor Kristen scream anymore. The Pinup Girl begins opening the curtains around the roo It is almost dawn and the sky behind the barn is beginnin grow pink.

The strangers take their time, turning off every light in the house one by one. The room is dark at first, but over the next few minutes, a warmth begins to grab the walls. The three of them stand in front of James and Kristen watching them cry. When the record is over, the house grows quiet. Pin Up go to change it and James and Kristen sit in silence. Their knees are almost touching and he slides his leg ove grazing her bruised and bloody skin with his own. He can see her ring and she knows.

I love you. The words come out so soft that only James can hear her.  95. James hums the song they danced to that night. His leg shakes against hers. Kristen’s face is too wet from tears see she still cries. Strawberry takes off her mask and lays it on the ground n the table. Soon, the others follow and, for the first tim they are exposed for who they are. The warm light now fills the room as the five of them sta at each other, waiting.

It’s time. Strawberry nods her head in agreement. He pulls out Kristen’s knife and kneels down before James The Man all of a sudden seems nervous. The knife shakes i one hand while he places the other on his knee for balanc Kristen tries to pull herself free, then she rips at the that holds James down.

You can stop. Do you hear me? It can stop now. The Man’s eyes shift slightly for a moment, staring into Kristen’s. KRISTEN (cont’d) I don’t care if it rains or freezes. Long as I have my Plastic Jesus, sitting on the dashboard of my car. She sings softly to her self and the Man watches her lips the words they both remember. James screams over and over as the Man leans in closer. H brings the knife towards James’ body slowly.

Be quiet. His words are not demands. He is almost asking her to sto singing. The blade shakes in his loose grip, but then, his fingers tighten around the handle.  96. When the knife pushes in, neither James nor the man seem know what will happen next. James squeals, pushing a scre through his teeth as he grinds his jaw. His muscles flex pain. Then he is silent, and Kristen grows still. The music explodes from the parlor, but Pin Up runs and t it off.

James, James...look at me. James look at me. The man stabs him again. This time he does it quickly and James watches the blade go inside him. Then, he tilts his head up towards Kristen, the veins in his neck about to burst. KRISTEN (cont’d) Look at me. Look at my face. The two women stand behind the man. Both seem pale and frightened. Pin Up bites her lip nervously, but Strawberr is energized, a very faint smile on the edges of her mout The Pin Up Girl walks over behind James and strokes his h KRISTEN (cont’d) Don’t touch him. At first, he fights her but then he lets go. He is calm. The Pin Up Girl’s hand rests on his neck. Strawberry takes the knife, and without taking her eyes o James’ face drives it into his chest. James coughs, his head whipping around. He does not fight anymore. He just cries. Strawberry raises her face up to the Pin Up Girl and thei eyes lock for a moment. Pin Up slowly moves around in fro of Kristen, but Kristen does not seem to notice. Kristen’s eyes fall to the ring case lying on the ground the table. She does not even react when blade goes in her KRISTEN (cont ‘d) James. James. James. She repeats his name over and over as the three strangers begin to cut her.  97. James sits doubled over beside her, unable to watch. His breathing becomes more and more clouded as he begins to choke. KRISTEN (cont‘d) James.

Kristen leans against the door of the car for support. Sh holds the ring in front of her. Tears form in her eyes. The sound of James’ rental shoes against the gravel seems echo throughout the empty cars that surround them. James stares at his hands nervously, he has not seen her face.
I thought you would like this one. I know how much you liked it when we saw it. At that store, you remember.

I remember. The door to the building bursts open and a GROUP OF WEDDI GUESTS comes out laughing. Kristen and James turn towards the crowd. Everyone has had too much to drink. As Kristen turns around, James sees her eyes, her face. T hope begins to drain from his expression. KRISTEN (cont‘d) James, I.
What?
James...

Oh. A car alarm goes off in the parking lot a few spaces down The group cannot seem to work their clicker.  98. ONE OF THE GROOMSMEN passes the couple as he makes his wa towards his friends. He stops and smiles at both of them. For a second, it seems as if he plans to stay. He hands James his glass of wine after he begins to feel awkwardness. James does not take his eyes off Kristen as she looks uncomfortably at the commotion around them.
The stabbing stops and they drop the knife on the ground Kristen's feet. Strawberry reaches out and touches her wounds. Kristen twists towards James. She tries to touch him once again.

I need you now. James. I need you. James’ gasps for air at the moment of her words. For just second, he is back again from the darkness. There is no sound of the blood that is filling his throat and lungs. face turns towards her briefly before sinking again to hi chest.
(Whispering) I know.

The sun peeks over the barn. It is hard for James to see because of the glare from the window. The man picks up his mask and the others’. The women star at Kristen’s dress as it turns red in front of them.
You are so pretty.

The Pin Up Girl goes into the kitchen behind them and was her hands. The man follows her and Strawberry goes last. They scrub until the blood is gone. They wash their faces and their arms.  99. Strawberry takes the knife and runs water over the blade until it is clean again. Then she lays it down on the counter.

They slowly take off their clothes until they each stand their underwear before the couple. They put their clothes a trash bag that the Pin Up Girl found under the sink. Strawberry hands out clean clothes from a bag she brings the door. James and Kristen are still alive.
The man walks over with the pile of records, holding them to the couple.

You can choose. Kristen’s eyes rise from James’ twitching leg. After he g through a few selections, her eyes rest on one of them an she nods. Blood pours from her mouth onto her thigh. Strawberry unties them both precisely so as to keep from cutting them as the man puts the record on.
The Pin Up Girl helps the man move the piano back into it original position. Then, they begin to straighten up the house. They start in the living room, working their way i the entry way.

James collapses onto the ground and Kristen does the same They seem like dolls. Their limbs disjointed like mannequins. Their arms and legs grow limp as the life dra from their bodies. James is barely breathing under the weight of his body.  100. The three strangers walk out of the house one at a time. one looks back at James and Kristen and soon, the house i still. Kristen slides her hand across the floor until it rests o James' back. Her hand moves up underneath his clothes unt she touches his skin. She grabs his gaze as she watches h eyes begin to falter. James breathes slower and slower until finally, he stops.

Kristen stares out along the hardwood floor listening to song spinning on the record player. She is no longer cryi The music fades and the record player hums, waiting for t next song. Kristen’s eyes glass over. For a moment, her breathing is the only sound in the room. The next song begins. Her hands slides down next to James body, one finger still reaching towards him. The wind chimes rattle against each other in the morning breeze. Then, the phone rings. Kristen does not react at first but on the second ring, i like her eyes come alive again. She begins to move toward the sound. The zipper on the back of her dress scratches the floor a she begins to push herself along the ground on her back. is slow at first. By the third ring, it seems like she ha barely moved at all. Her hands scratch at the floor as she forces her body ove Her arms, her entire body, are now covered in blood. Kristen struggles into the living room and by the fourth ring, the old man is within her sight. The ringing comes from him. Beside her the Smiley face rests, having fallen from the strangers’ bag. She loses her balance, and her wrist gives way. Her face slams against the hardwood floor. The dull thud of her he colliding against the wood is sickening, but Kristen continues.  101. She grabs the old man-her hands searching over his bloody body. The damage James has done to him begins to cover he as Kristen’s hands caress every inch of his body. Finally she hears the ring once again. The phone is on the ground inches away from her face. Her hand reaches out just as the last ring escapes the sm handheld piece of plastic. She forces herself on top of t his remains, stretching her body out to grab the phone be it stops ringing. She slides it to her ear, but there is no one there.

Hello? Hello! Kristen’s eyes close. There is just a dial tone. She fall back to the ground. The Man stands behind her. Kristen begins dialing the phone. Her fingers slip across small keys. First she dials 9, then two 1’s.

How do you know that song? A scream explodes in the hallway as Kristen turns. She forces her body over again, this time to face her attacke Her small hands rises above her head like a shield, but t Man does not seem to notice. His young face hovers above her. The phone lies beside Kristen, still silent. The send key untouched. The Man finally kneels by her side, taking the mask that rested beside her. MAN (cont’d) It makes me happy. He turns his back on her and walks towards the door. Soon he is gone. Kristen is alone.

The washed out sky hangs over the open fields in the midd of nowhere. It has rained recently and the ground is wet around the scattered mail boxes that line the old gravel road.  102. The street is deserted. Empty.
Okay. Let’s try and do this all at once.(Coughs) Can you hear me alright? I’m just gonna start. Alright?

The large single story house sits a thousand yards from i closest neighbor. There is a long cement driveway that le down the side of the property. At the end, towards the house, sits a once blue four-door sedan. Smoke rises above the charred remains. The windows are smashed out and the tires are slashed. Broken pieces glass surround the car as it sits flat against its metal rims. The car is running. Over the blackened hood stands a faded basketball goal. A net hangs on for its life from the rusty orange hoop.

1801 Clark Road. Stop. (Coughs) 1801 Clark Road as follows. 4 kitchen knives, varying sizes. 2 candle sticks. One large axe with wooden handle. The pick up truck idles in the street as the Man looks at rear tire. The Pin Up Girl sits in the back, a cigarette weighing her hand down over the side. The Man gets back inside the cab and the truck rumbles ba to life and begins the journey down the long road.

Two young boys, both in their early teens, walk side by s with their bicycles. They wear pressed white shirts and black slacks. They are Mormons. The taller boy, has a backpack slung over one shoulder. T other one holds a pile of pamphlets. They both have flat tops.  103. The boys make their way down the street and they huddle c together to attempt to shield themselves from the wind whipping across their skin. The truck pulls to a noisy stop and Strawberry gets out o the passenger side. She is crying a little as she walks around the back of the truck. Her door still hanging open She approaches the boys, she is not much larger than they are.
Can I have one? The smaller boy hands her the yellow piece of paper. It struggles in the wind, but Strawberry catches it.
Are you a sinner?

Sometimes. She turns back towards the truck and without a look back climbs inside. The truck and the three strangers soon disappear onto the highway. A few of the pamphlets get away from the small one and he chases after them but then soon returns, empty-handed. They are two houses down from the basketball goal. They t turns walking to each house, knocking and ringing the doorbells. When there is no answer, they leave the pamphl on the mat or in the mailbox and walk back up to the road again. The boys do not play around with each other as they walk road between houses. They concentrate on the task at hand each solemnly staring forward as they pass the overgrown yards.
Matches. One double barrel shot gun. 5 empty shells. Baling wire. A broken champagne bottle. Two empty bottles of beer.

Music drifts out to where they stand on the street from somewhere within the large house.  104. The boy with the backpack waits at the mailbox as the sma one walks down the driveway towards the blue Saturn. The smaller boy waves and calls out for his friend to com closer. The music grows louder so as to drown out all oth sound. Eventually, the boy with the backpack lays both the bikes down on the side of the street and walks towards the fron porch, cutting across the grass. The smaller boy stands near the car, staring at his reflection in the broken driver’s side window. He calls o to the boy with the backpack again, then chases after him towards the house.

The boy with the backpack picks up a champagne cork as th walk along the sidewalk to the porch. The smaller boy lau nervously as they get closer. The boy with the backpack does not take his eyes off what left of the front door Several pieces of wood lie at their feet as they stand un the eave of the house. The boy with the backpack nudges h friend towards the door, but neither one walks inside.
Hello? Their bikes remain on the street.
A lot of blood. In several rooms. We have some usable prints.

Dark shadows still surround most of the living room ahead them as the boys make their way down the entry way hall. smashed pieces of a fire alarm lie on the ground. Inaudible beneath the sound of the music, the boys call o as they walk through the darkened room, the pamphlets han at the younger boys’ side.  105.
(Coughs) No conformation yet on names. We’re working on it. We/’ll be here all night.
The boys walk through the living room as the music grows louder. No one responds to their calls.
A record spins on an old worn out player. The needle is close to the end as the volume steadily rises.

That’s all we got right now. Let’s go. Turn this thing off. Fuck. This is horrible. I think he might have proposed. (Rattling sounds, then a burst of sirens. The tape shuts off.) The record slows and then stops leaving only the sound of static as the needle rides the edges before stopping. The house is completely quiet. The younger boy sees her first and approaches her body tentatively. His movements show his fear as he kneels bef her and softly his touches her face. He turns to call to his friend and Kristen bolts up, her hands ripping at his shirt. One of the boys screams. CUT TO BLACK.  106.
